alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Bernard and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 130 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Pointe A La Hache, or 14 miles north of Port Sulphur, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poydras. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper St. Bernard
